intro: Camissonia contorta, commonly known as the bentstem camissonia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. This perennial herb is characterized by its slender, often zigzagging stems and small, clustered leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pink and are arranged in dense, spike-like inflorescences. Camissonia contorta thrives in moist, rocky habitats and is often found in coastal areas and mountainous regions.
